meanings.definition: To strengthen or give power to something by adding sinews.
meanings.sent1: She sinewed the rope to make it stronger.
meanings.sent2: He always sinews the bow before archery practice.
meanings.sent3: The chef sinewed the stew with extra meat for a powerful flavor.
meanings.sent4: His determination sinewed his resolve to overcome any obstacle.
meanings.sent5: The blacksmith sinewed the sword, ensuring its durability in battle.

meanings.definition: The act of adding sinews to something.
meanings.sent1: The sinewing of the structure was crucial for its stability.
meanings.sent2: She studied the art of sinewing in ancient sculptures.
meanings.sent3: The sinewing of the costume made it look more realistic on stage.
meanings.sent4: The sinewing of the ship's hull was a meticulous process.
meanings.sent5: The sinewing of the team with new players improved their performance.

meanings.definition: The process of making something stronger by adding sinews.
meanings.sent1: The sinewing of the fabric increased its durability.
meanings.sent2: The sinewing of the armor was done with great care.
meanings.sent3: The sinewing of the friendship with shared experiences was heartwarming.
meanings.sent4: The sinewing of the bridge ensured its resilience against harsh weather.
meanings.sent5: The sinewing of the alliance between the two nations was a strategic move.
